highlights: Led initiative adding screen sharing functionality to the primary web application
Created, launched, and contributed to the Maxwell engineering blog

work.summary: As a JavaScript consultant, I worked across the stack in a variety of applications to support our client. Whether it was designing new applications to process COVID-19 Payment Protection Program loans in 2020, or enhancing performance on legacy loan administration applications, I provided flexible, results-driven development support for clients.
highlights: Developed spreadsheet application using RxJS and React, supporting reference cells and formulas
Implemented cross-project micro frontend solution in React to transition from a legacy app to a new architecture while still adding new features, fixing old bugs, and addressing tech debt
Deployed backend services in Node and Koa to integrate with React apps as well as third party services
Managed a “squad” of four developers, focused on a single client application

work.summary: As the first front end developer at TopstepTrader, collaborate cross-departmentally to create reusable front end assets, maintain a high standard of front end focused code and architecture, orchestrate testing and data analysis, and automate marketing processes.
highlights: Architected micro frontend solution to migrate from an Angular 2 monolith into a leaner, React solution
Led front end engineering team across a tech stacks including Angular 2, React, Python Django templates, Hubspot HubL, custom Wordpress themes, and native HTML/CSS/JavaScript
Designed, developed, and implemented a reusable component library, using Webpack to compile modular ES6+ JavaScript and SCSS into static, cross-browser-ready JavaScript and CSS
Improved first paint time 300% through a site migration from Wordpress to a faster Node and Gulp solution
Led front end developer hiring by creating technical tests and interview processes to verify candidates' skills

work.summary: I interned with MacUpdate for two consecutive summers. During my first internship, I was able to lead an initiative in bringing responsive design to the site for the first time. My second summer with MacUpdate, I led an SEO initiative improving page performance and on-page SEO.
highlights: Designed and implemented a front end build process using Grunt and Node, which fully automated caching, bundling, and minification of front end assets, and reduced average page size by 15%, or ~250KB per page

work.summary: Working on the university website gave me the opportunity to write custom features for faculty, teach sessions on using our CMS, and help lead an holistic SEO initiative.
highlights: Authored web pages, forms, and apps for university departments using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and PHP
Organized and led classes detailing basic HTML, content creation, and best UI/UX practices for >200 users

publications.name: HUB
publications.summary: HUB is a personal wiki with full markdown and SMS upload support. HUB uses React, Node, Mongo, and Webhooks to provide customizable wikis that can be updated from anywhere.

publications.name: WAILto
publications.summary: WAILto is a music history analysis app. Using Node, React Hooks, and PostgreSQL, WAILto provides modular, extensible data analysis and data visualizations on Last.fm data.
